description: Number of connected 3 X n binary matrices (divided by 2).
comments: A connected (0,1) matrix is one where you can get from any black square, i.e. 1, to any other by chess king moves.
references: R. Levy and J. Shapiro, Uniqueness in paint-by-numbers puzzles, preprint, 2000.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (7, -3, 5).
prog: (MAGMA) I:=[3, 21, 143]; [n le 3 select I[n] else 7*Self(n-1)-3*Self(n-2)+5*Self(n-3): n in [1..20]]; // Vincenzo Librandi, Feb 14 2012
crossrefs: Number of connected 3 X n binary matrices = 2*A054419 = 4*A054417 + 2*A054418.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 22 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, May 23 2000
